top_comment.text:
i have eaten trout once and i find it has a very strong fishy taste. is it 
just me or its normal in trout?﻿
top_comment.author: Maxwell A

comments.text:
Fishier it is the longer it is been dead.I suggest you get a fresh one from 
a fisher market find one that smells something similar to a light river or 
ocean smell( fresh fish always smell faint of where it has been caught). If 
you can't get a hold of fresh one you'll have to make due with using 
herbs/lemon to cut down it's strong fishy taste.
comments.author: ShikiKaze

comments.text:
I find the right seasoning makes trout one of the tastier fish to eat 
actually.
comments.author: Kate Gallagher

comments.text:
trout is a fish from the salmonide familie and the have a good amout of 
fat, it has a little spezial flavor, but if u cook them right its one of 
the sort of fish what nearly everybody likes, exept those ppl who dont like 
fish
comments.author: Mosurabee

comments.text:
No not normally having a mild taste like most fresh water fish,( unless 
they were not fresh)? i smoke mine in a food smoker box.

I thought would take a look at this it's actually really

I have chef. Good man good man. And do you want to get some of those herbs into there or should I? I'd love to
Do you want me to stuff them in hard? Please, please.
Let's tie it up, while we're tying this up, I've got all these beautiful, really fine garlic slithers
some of them aren't so fine but that's okay because it's going to cook for quite a while in here

this works well but kale work really

just sort of cut them into large chunks and
then we can look at grilling those up as well
these are baby leeks, you can just put them directly
on this grill. Do your Aussie accent. Mate, mate
the fish the fish is done the fish is done mate

The way I always tell if a fish is
cooked is kinda by touching it around here

which is one of the thickest parts. Absolutely. And as
soon as that gets

kind of a little bit firm you know you
pretty much ready to rock
So this is starting to char up really nicely here

These don't take long at all but these
smaller ones are done, those big ones
just need a little bit more
yep these tomatoes are probably good. Let's get them off, just pop them here for a sec
and I'm going to pull the skin off there while they're hot
Look how easy that skin comes off. Straight off. Just pinch it off.
We can start to think about cooking this cavolo now as well
This doesn't take long at all you can pretty much eat this raw
Colour's gone beautiful. It's awesome isn't it?
Chuck them on here cause once they're done, here you go

loosen that up with a couple of tablespoons of
extra-virgin olive
Chop those tomatoes in half and just kind of squeeze those in a little bit

keeping the flesh intact as well and
then that hot kale
and the hot baby leeks in there will really kind of sop up all those juices
and we're going to get this garlic in there as well J, just kind of pop that into there
So I'm coming in alright. Come in let's get a little bit of salt
and then we can get some of this lemon juice
